Uses of Interface
javax.time.chrono.ChronoLocalDate

  • Packages that use ChronoLocalDate 
    Package Description
    javax.time
    The main API for dates, times, instants, and durations.
    javax.time.chrono
    Support for calendar systems other than the default ISO.
    javax.time.chrono.global
    Support for calendar systems other than the default ISO.

    • Uses of ChronoLocalDate in javax.time

      Classes in javax.time that implement ChronoLocalDate 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  LocalDate
      A date without a time-zone in the ISO-8601 calendar system, such as 2007-12-03.
      Methods in javax.time with parameters of type ChronoLocalDate 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int LocalDate.compareTo(ChronoLocalDate<?> other)
      Compares this date to another date.
      boolean LocalDate.isAfter(ChronoLocalDate<?> other)
      Checks if this date is after the specified date ignoring the chronology.
      boolean LocalDate.isBefore(ChronoLocalDate<?> other)
      Checks if this date is before the specified date ignoring the chronology.
      boolean LocalDate.isEqual(ChronoLocalDate<?> other)
      Checks if this date is equal to the specified date ignoring the chronology.

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Comparator<ChronoLocalDate<?>> ChronoLocalDate.DATE_COMPARATOR

      Obtains a date in this era given the year-of-era, month, and day.

      Obtains a local date in this chronology from another date-time object.
      ChronoLocalDate<C> Chrono.dateNow()
      Obtains the current local date in this chronology from the system clock in the default time-zone.

      Obtains the current local date in this chronology from the specified clock.

      Obtains the current local date in this chronology from the system clock in the specified time-zone.

      Obtains a local date in this chronology from the proleptic-year and day-of-year fields.
